title: Add option to drop translated UID/GID values if theyy are translated
body: Close #157

title: Support logging dropped records into separate log
body: This is intended to be used for debugging and/or for keeping "dropped" records in the SIEM for a shorter time.

title: Coalesce::emit_fn: Make filtering the user's responsibility
Implement a key-based process table
body:
Processes are now uniquely identified by a ProcessKey instead of
process IDs as those may be recycled quickly.

Most of the code interfacing with the process table has been pulled
into the early part of Coalesce::transform_event that handles SYSCALL
messages.

The test introduced with #168 now passes.

Fixes #146

Performance-wise, this is a slight improvement over current master.

This branch:

```
test parse_only      ... bench:  20,237,394 ns/iter (+/- 235,818)
test parse_serialize ... bench:  27,426,770 ns/iter (+/- 255,343)
```

master (f237694c3cea11ab805ea2ebf4058a3106018821):

```
test parse_only      ... bench:  22,737,572 ns/iter (+/- 397,532)
test parse_serialize ... bench:  30,010,731 ns/iter (+/- 369,789)
```

title: Add test demonstrating process tracking confusion
body: This is based upon data observed in production systems. Due to PID reuse, the wrong process metadata could be used for PID enrichment.

title: Move procfs-specific code into optional module
body: Making procfs support optional lets us build a "pure" filtering version of Laurel for debugging purposes or for running in non-auditd-plugin setups.

title: Simplify some aspects of the parser
body: This is unlikely to improve performance, but at least we get rid of some type annotations that have bothered me for a while.

title: Get rid of RUSTC wrapper for static musl builds
Update bindgen version
body: Close #160

title: Restart laurel on SIGHUP
body:
When we catch SIGHUP, all remaining input in the buffer is fed to coalesce, coalesce is flushed. Laurel is restarted with identical configuration parameters and capabilities.

Implements part of #133

title: Track processes across fork without execve
body: This does not yet solve the entire problem of #146, but with the right audit ruleset (which logs all fork/vfork/clone calls for shells and other processes that use fork without exec), this should at least improve the situation.

title: Build SELinux policy on Amazon Linux 2023
Support connecting to local socket to consume audit messages
body: Close #141

title: Added null key filter #137
body:
* Additional test case inside of filter_key
* Else case after key check

**Note:** If the "null" key string is contained in the filter_keys array, this will filter out all events not containing a key. One could argue that the auditd rule-set should specify all events which should be logged and therefore set keys for the events leading to no unwanted "null" keys (make explicit what is implicit)

As to my understanding other tools like Sysmon are also only logging what is specified in the config.

Looking forward to feedback and opinions

body:
For now, it ought to be enough to add some context to standard error messages.

Close #135

title: Build different SELinux policy variants for differnt distros
body:
While auditd 3.x spawns plug-ins directly, auditd 2.x uses audispd as an intermediary, therefore different transitions ought to be defined.

Building an "universal" policy is still possible as of EL9 (Rocky), but we don't know whether this will last.

title: Add configuration option to remove labels from processes
Analyse exec events for script execution
body:
For execve events, assume that differences between the file referenced by SYSCALL.exe and the first PATH entry indicate that a script is being invoked through the "#!" mechanism.

If the PATH entry contains relative path, ".", "..", and double slashes are normalized.

This information is used to add SYSCALL.SCRIPT and to add process labels.

Caveats:

1. Inspecting SYSCALL.exe is racy.

2. SYSCALL.exe is looked at through the /proc/<pid>/root "lens" to try to treat mount namespaces used by container runtimes containers properly. Unfortunately, this does not seem to work for Podman containers yet.

title: Avoid clippy warnings
body:
- you are deriving `PartialEq` and can implement `Eq`
- deref on an immutable reference

title: Explicitly set permitted, inheritable capabilities
body:
Permitted capabilities can be regained by laurel itself. Those are limited to what is actually needed. If an exploitable arbitrary code execution vulnerability is discovered in Laurel, this limits what can be done within the process.

Inhereitable capabilities are transferred across execve, those are eliminated altogether. If a vulnerability is discovered that may cause laurel to launch arbitrary programs, such a program will not inherit any special capabilities, only the _laurel user.

title: Build SELinux policy on Amazon Linux
Add log for dumping log lines that can't be parsed
Fix some corner-cases in the parser
body:
These commits add test cases and some fixes for parser failures observed on production systems

- SOCKADDR.SADDR added by _auditd_ `log_format=ENRICHED`  (not completely fixed
- USER_AUTH.msg provided by a combination of libpam and appareently broken Python library code

title: Avoid log file related race conditions
body: Among other things, `tail --follow=name` would when LAUREL is restarted by auditd and when it rotates log files. Root causes for both are fixed in this PR.

title: Add PID enrichment
body: Close #104

title: Refine data types
body:
Since keys are short, there's no need to use references from the input buffer. This lets us get rid of PKey, RKey. The most common keys are encoded in a Common variant.

Value::Map now uses newly introduced SimpleKey and SimpleValue types.

title: Optimize proc
body: Try to read /proc directory and individual files in one go

title: Drop enriched values in parser if translate.* has been set
Add cargo fmt to build workflow, remove hacky tab-in-source check

Remove PARENT_INFO.ARGV
body:
Rationale: ARGV is redundant and will lead to bloat. comm, exe are
already there and if ARGV is needed, it can be accessed via the event
ID corresponding to its last execve call.

title: Add test, fixes for uid, gid translations
Do not rotate if filesize is 0
body:
We are using Laurel in a way that file rotate is annoying. Instead of having to set u64::MAX in the configuration, I propose that setting 0 should disable file rotation.

Moreover the config is printing invalid values at startup, if size and generation are not set, the defaults one from rotate are used, not 0.

Let me know what you think about it, i'm not a Rust expert. :sweat_smile:

title: fix: drop execute bit from src/sockaddr.rs
body:
`src/sockaddr.rs` has execute bit which messes up packaging:
```
+ /usr/lib/rpm/redhat/brp-mangle-shebangs
*** ERROR: ./usr/src/debug/rust-laurel-0.3.1-1.fc35.x86_64/src/sockaddr.rs has shebang which doesn't start with '/' ([allow(non_upper_case_globals)])
*** ERROR: ./usr/share/cargo/registry/laurel-0.3.1/src/sockaddr.rs has shebang which doesn't start with '/' ([allow(non_upper_case_globals)])
mangling shebang in /usr/share/cargo/registry/laurel-0.3.1/contrib/musl-static-build/rustc-wrapper from /bin/sh to #!/usr/bin/sh
error: Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.roLEgM (%install)


RPM build errors:
    Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.roLEgM (%install)
```

title: Feature/parser fix
body: It turned out that even double-quoted strings may contain "characters with [special meaning](https://github.com/linux-audit/audit-documentation/wiki/SPEC-Writing-Good-Events) to the parser".

title: Add PARENT_INFO.{id,exe,comm}
body: The id points to the execve-related event from which the parent process entry was created. The exe and comm fields are taken from SYSCALL but can be constructed from /proc/$PID if the SYSCALL event has not been observecd.

title: Add SYSCALL.key-based process label feature
body:
This feature allows for adding labels to processes or process subtrees based on the "key" attribute transmitted with the SYSCALL message.

A typical usecase would be add labels based on specific filesystem events (exec of apt, rpm, yum, ssm-agent, etc.) in order to add context for actions taken by admin or package maintainer scripts that can be queried easily.

difference in "cargo bench".

title: Optimize process environment access
body:
Instead of returning a slice of environment variables most of which
are not going to be collected, change proc::get_environ to take a
predicate function that decides what to collect.

If no matching variables are found, still insert: "ENV": []
